sentence.Network_en: She tried to monopolize his time.
Even in brothels he wanted to monopolize because he had money.
sentence.Network_cn: 逛暗娼他也想独占,因为他有钱.

sentence.Network_en: She tended to monopolize the conversation.
sentence.Network_cn: 她说个没完,使别人插不上嘴.

entry.def: If you say that someone monopolizes something, you mean that they have a very large share of it and prevent other people from having a share.

example.ex: They are controlling so much cocoa that they are virtually monopolizing the market...
example.tran: 他们控制了大量的可可粉，因此他们几乎垄断了整个市场。

example.ex: Johnson, as usual, monopolized the conversation.
example.tran: 跟平常一样，约翰逊说个没完，别人插不上话。

entry.tran: 占去…很多时间和注意力;独占
entry.def: If something or someone monopolizes you, they demand a lot of your time and attention, so that there is very little time left for anything or anyone else.

example.ex: He would monopolize her totally, to the exclusion of her brothers and sisters.
example.tran: 他会完全占据她的时间，一点儿都不留给她的兄弟姐妹们。

means.word_mean: 1. have and control fully and exclusively;
2. have or exploit a monopoly of;

auth_sentence.content: To confine, forestall, and monopolize the beams of the sun.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: To confine, forestall, and monopolize the beams of the sun.

Sentence.sentence: We learn from the passage that in today's world, whoever monopolizes the oil market will be able to exercise extraordinary power.

means.word_mean: 垄断, 独占;专卖, 专营

sentences.en: An electric power company monopolizes the power supply in this area.
sentences.cn: 一家电力公司垄断了该地区的电力供应。
